CLINICAL FEATURES
LOCOREGIONAL
dyspnea, cough, chest pain, hoar

METASTATIC
CONSTITUTIONAL
weight loss, anorexia, fatigue
PARANEOPLASTIC
myasthenia gravis (30 50%,
diplopia, ptosis, dysphagia, weakness, fatigue),
pure red cell aplasia (5 15%), pure white cell apla
sia,
pancytopenia,
hypogammaglobulinemia
(recurrent infections, diarrhea), rheumatologic dis
eases, and endocrinopathies. Note that remission of
thymoma does not necessarily correlate with
improvement of paraneoplastic syndromes

T stage
 T1=intact capsule
 T2=macroscopically invades surrounding fatty

 T3=invades pericardium, great vessels, lung
 T4=pleural or pericardial dissemination
N stage
 N1=anterior mediastinal LN
 N2=other intrathoracic LN
 N3=extrathoracic LN
M stage (drop metastasis in pleural space)
 M1=distant metastasis
